column4: Hi all, a question: I once made the mistake of saving my gnome session. Although, I have disabled it (a long time age), every time I restart the system, I get the same application. Is there a cache, ... somewhere that I should remove?
for example, fetchmail
i would like to restart the fetchmail daemon each time a restart
Start login and close all apps then in the session properties press on the save button again. Otherwise your session is saved in .local if I remember
rm -r ~/config/gnome-session
rm -r ~/.config/gnome-session
thanks!
i am gonna try it, hopefully it works
there is also a ~/.config/session-state, shouldn't I remove that too?
could you check if yours is empty?
delete that too.
okay thanks again
You also have a autostart if you have added stuff
what do you mean?
I have added things like fetchmail and conky to startup programs in gnome "Startup Applications Pereferences" dialog
If you do not have that folder then it is ok
i used to work just fine, until I saved the session once ....
okay
Then it is in your autostart folder.
~/.config/autostart
It is fine then. Try to relog then
